messages.subject: early stories
messages.msgSnippet: Whoa, flashbacks here too. When Dana was 2ish, she used to talk about her life before she picked us to be her family.  And she always made sure to hold my
messages.messageBody:
Whoa, flashbacks here too.

When Dana was 2ish, she used to talk about her life before she "picked" us
to be her family. And she always made sure to hold my hand in parking lots
because she didn't want me to be hit by a car again( I had NEVER been hit by
a car in a parking lot). She would go into incredible detail on the
incident and I didn't know if she was psychic or lived through that before -
but I made SURE I held her hand. Dana doesn't remember those stories
anymore. It is sad for me, that she has forgotten.

When my niece was the same age, she would say "when I was a boy" and tell us
lovely stories.

sistakammi
who needs to be a wrappin while Dana and Joe are at a friends making venison
jerky!



>
> She told me her mother died when she was a little girl and she was very
sad
> about it. It has always made me wonder if she had a fabulously developed
> imagination, or if whe was recalling a past life, or (I hope not) seeing
> into the future (we now live where there aren't many trees and it's white
> for 6 months out of the year.) No matter what, it was an odd conversation
to
> have with a 2 year old. She doesn't remember any of it now. She's 7.
>
> ~Mary
